page.title: 17DRUMOAK SCHOOL FIELD TRIP
page.content: On Monday 29th April,1985, a party of thirteen pupils and two teachers from Drumoak Primary School set off on a week's excursion. After a journey of 24 miles they arrived at their destination -{Angus House, Edzell. Angus House is a large comfortable house in which groups of pupils and teachers can live and work for either a week or a weekend. During their stay at Angus House, the Drumoak Group made a number of visits. These included visits to places of historical interest, such as{Edzell Castle, The {Retreat Museum, Glenesk and Fasque {House.}They also made a number of {nature walks. The end of their stay arrived all too quickly.However, everyone agreed that they had spent a most enjoyable week and had a very interesting experience of living in their 'home from home'.
